TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract _Application3 implements class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust._Application, class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust._Application2

Docs.summary: This type is a wrapper for a COM interface implemented by a coclass that is required by managed code for COM interoperability. To access the members specified by this interface, use the type that wraps the coclass that implements this interface. For information about that type, including usage, remarks, and examples, see.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ActiveWindow As WindowObject

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to a object that represents the currently active window.

remarks.para: Using the ActiveWindow property, you can gain immediate access to the window that is currently being viewed by the user, and then use the properties and methods of the Window object that it returns.
Important: This member can be accessed without restrictions.

example.para: In the following example, the ActiveWindow property is used to gain access to the property of the object that returns a object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CacheSolution(string bstrSolutionURI) cil managed

Docs.param: Specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the form template. This parameter can be specified as a form definition (.xsf) file or a form template (.xsn) file.
Docs.summary: Examines the form template in the cache and, if necessary, updates it from the published location of the form template.

remarks.para: If the form template that currently exists in the cache matches the form template from the published location, no caching takes place. If the computer is offline and the form is already in the cache, the cache is kept and no update will occur.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

example.para: In the following example, the CacheFormTemplate custom function loops through the location for each the form template specified in the forms array and passes that value to the CacheSolution method for evaluation.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property COMAddIns As Object
public: property System::Object ^ COMAddIns { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a Microsoft.Office.Core.COMAddIns object containing information about the COM Add-ins registered for the current InfoPath application.
Docs.value: A Microsoft.Office.Core.COMAddIns collection that contains information about the COM Add-ins registered for the current InfoPath application.

remarks.para: The COMAddIns object returned by the InfoPath COMAddIns property is implemented in the Microsoft.Office.Core namespace. The Microsoft.Office.Core.COMAddIns object provides information about the collection of InfoPath COM add-ins that are registered in the Windows registry of the user's computer. To access the members of Microsoft.Office.Core namespace, you must first add a reference to the Microsoft Office 14.0 Object Library on the COM tab of the Add Reference dialog box in Visual Studio.

To use the COMAddIns property to access the Microsoft.Office.Core.COMAddIns object, you must cast the object returned by the InfoPath COMAddIns property to the Office COMAddIns type as shown in the code example.

Additionally, because the COMAddIns property is new to Microsoft InfoPath, you must also declare and cast to the type to access this property. For more information, see How to: Use Object Model Members That Are Not Compatible with InfoPath 2003.

This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

example.para: The following example accesses the first item in the COMAddIns collection that is returned by the ComAddIns property.
example.code:
Dim objectReference As Object = 1
Dim app As Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.Application = _ thisApplication
Dim myCOMAddIns As Microsoft.Office.Core.COMAddIns = _ DirectCast(app, _Application3).COMAddIns
Dim myCOMAddIn As Microsoft.Office.Core.COMAddIn = _ myCOMAddIns.Item(objectReference)

MemberSignature.Value: public string FormatString (object varInput, string bstrCategory, string bstrOptions);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string FormatString(object varInput, string bstrCategory, string bstrOptions) cil managed
Public Function FormatString (varInput As Object, bstrCategory As String, bstrOptions As String) As String
public: System::String ^ FormatString(System::Object ^ varInput, System::String ^ bstrCategory, System::String ^ bstrOptions);
abstract member FormatString : obj * string * string -> string

Docs.param: The value or XML node to be formatted.
The value that specifies the category used for formatting. Values include number, percentage, currency, date, time, and datetime.
The value that specifies the options used for formatting. Takes the form of a case-sensitive string in the format "optionName:value".
Docs.summary: Formats the specified string or XML node according to the specified category and options parameters.
Docs.returns: A string formatted according to the specified category and options parameters.

remarks.para: The FormatString method can be used anywhere you need to change the format of a specified string. It must be qualified with the Application name, and its return value must be assigned to a variable or used as an expression that requires a string value.
The following sections list the values that may be used for and :
List of categories

item.description: Uses numerical values. Valid options for this category include "locale", "numDigits", "leadingZero", "grouping", "decimalSep", "thousandSep", and "negativeOrder".
Uses percentage values. Valid options for this category include "locale", "numDigits", "leadingZero", "grouping", "decimalSep", "thousandSep", and "negativeOrder".

Uses currency values. Valid options for this category include "locale", "numDigits", "leadingZero", "grouping", "decimalSep", "thousandSep", and "negativeOrder", "positiveOrder", and "currencyLocale".
Uses date values. Valid options for this category include "locale", "dateFormat", "useAltCalendar", and "useEnglishStringsAlways".
Uses time values. Valid options for this category include "locale", "timeFormat", and "noSeconds".
Uses datetime values. Valid options for this category include "locale", "dateFormat", "timeFormat", "noSeconds", "useAltCalendar", and "useEnglishStringAlways".

remarks.para: List of options

item.description: Specifies the locale identifier (LCID). Defaults to the current user's LCID if not specified.

Specifies the number of fractional digits after the decimal separator. The value auto may also be used to indicate that the number of decimal places that was entered will be the number of decimal places in the output. For example, 1.234, 1.234, 1.00, 1.00, 1.56e2, or 156.00. Defaults to the corresponding value in regional settings if not specified.

Specifies whether to use leading zeros in decimal fields. Specify 0 to indicate no leading zeros and 1 to indicate leading zeros. Defaults to the corresponding value in regional settings if not specified.

Specifies the size of each group of digits to the left of the decimal. Values in the range 0–9 and value 32 are valid. Value 32 indicates that the grouping is three digits, then two digits thereafter. Defaults to the corresponding value in regional settings if not specified.
Specifies the decimal separator string. Defaults to the corresponding value in regional settings if not specified.
Specifies the thousands separator string. Defaults to the corresponding value in regional settings if not specified.
Specifies the negative number mode. Defaults to the corresponding value in regional settings if not specified.
Specifies the positive number mode. Defaults to the corresponding value in regional settings if not specified.
Specifies the locale identifier (LCID) for the currency symbol. Defaults to the value specified by locale if not specified.

Specifies a format picture string that is used to form the date string. The values "Short Date", "Long Date", "Year Month", and "none" may also be used to indicate short date format, long date format, year month format, and no format, respectively. "Short Date", "Long Date", and "Year Month" are the default formats provided by the operating system's regional and language settings.
Specifies whether to use an alternate calendar for date formatting. Specify 0 to use the normal calendar and 1 to use the alternate calendar. Defaults to 0 if not specified.
Specifies whether to always use English strings for date formatting. Specify 0 to use the language specified by locale and 1 to always use English. Defaults to 0 if not specified.
Specifies a format string that is used to form the time string. The value "none" may also be used to indicate no format. Defaults to the time format in regional settings if not specified.
Specifies whether to not use seconds. Specify 0 to use seconds and 1 to not use seconds. Defaults to 0 if not specified.

example.para: In the following example, the FormatString method of the object is used to format the specified date string into a long date format:
example.code: Dim myDate As String = thisApplication.FormatString( _ "2003-01-08", "date", "dateFormat:Long Date")

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetSolutionURI(string bstrCacheID) cil managed
Public Function GetSolutionURI (bstrCacheID As String) As String

Docs.param: A string that identifies the form template in the local InfoPath form cache.
Docs.summary: Gets the Uniform Resource Locator (URL) or universal naming convention (UNC) location of a form template from the local cache ID.
Docs.returns: The URL or UNC for the published location of the form template.

remarks.para: The value to pass as the parameter can be identified from the following location in the file system:
Where foldername is a random name assigned in a user's form cache, and cacheID is the name of the folder that contains the cached form template and the cache ID value.

Because the GetSolutionURI method is new to Microsoft InfoPath, you must declare and cast to the type to access this method. For more information, see How to: Use Object Model Members That Are Not Compatible with InfoPath 2003.

This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

example.para: In the following example, a cache ID value is passed to the GetSolutionURI method to display the published location of the form template.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsDestinationReachable(string bstrDestination) cil managed
Public Function IsDestinationReachable (bstrDestination As String) As Boolean

Docs.param: Specifies the location to check for network connectivity. IP addresses, UNC paths, or URLs are acceptable values.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the specified Uniform Resource Locator (URL), universal naming convention (UNC) path, or IP address of the destination computer can be connected to from the client computer.
Docs.returns: true if the destination computer is reachable; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: The value specified for must be either a UNC path that includes a server name and a share name, such as @"\\MyServer\MyShare", or a URL that begins with one of the following protocol identifiers: http, https, or file.
Important: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LanguageSettings As Object
public: property System::Object ^ LanguageSettings { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the Microsoft Office LanguageSettings.

remarks.para: After you establish a reference to the LanguageSettings object returned by the LanguageSettings property, you can access all the properties and methods of the object.

The LanguageSettings object returned by the InfoPath LanguageSettings property is implemented in the Microsoft.Office.Core namespace. The Microsoft.Office.Core.LanguageSettings object provides information about the Microsoft Office language settings that are in use on the user's computer.

To access the members of Microsoft.Office.Core namespace, you must first add a reference to the Microsoft Office 14.0 Object Library on the COM tab of the Add Reference dialog box in Visual Studio 2012.

To use the LanguageSettings property to access the Microsoft.Office.Core.LanguageSettings object, you must cast the object returned by InfoPath LanguageSettings property to the Office LanguageSettings type as shown in the code example.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

example.para: The following example uses the LanguageID property of the LanguageSettings object to return the LCID value (a four-digit number) for the language that is currently being used for the Office user interface.
This example requires a using or Imports directive for the Microsoft.Office.Core namespace in the declarations section of the form code module.
example.code: Dim langSettings As LanguageSettings = DirectCast(thisApplication.LanguageSettings, LanguageSettings) Dim lcid As Integer = langSettings.LanguageID(MsoAppLanguageID.msoLanguageIDUI)

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MachineOnlineState As XdMachineOnlineState

Docs.summary: Gets the current connection state of the client computer.

remarks.para: Important: This member can be accessed without restrictions.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Name As String
public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the InfoPath application.

remarks.para: The name of the application does not contain the version number. To obtain the version number of an application, use the property.
Important: This member can be accessed without restrictions.

example.para: In the following example, the method of the object, accessed through the object is used to display a message box that indicates the name of the application:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object NewADODBConnection() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates and gets a reference to an empty ActiveX Data Objects (ADO) Connection object.
Docs.returns: A reference to an ADO Connection object.

remarks.para: If the form is not fully trusted, the NewADODBConnection method will return a "permission denied" error.

Note: This method is not intended to be used in a managed-code form. To query a Microsoft SQL Server database, use the System.Data.SqlClient namespace and its associated members by adding a reference to System.Data.dll and a using clause to System.Data.SqlClient.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object NewADODBRecordset() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates and gets a reference to an empty ActiveX Data Objects (ADO) Recordset object.
Docs.returns: A reference to an empty ActiveX Data Objects (ADO) Recordset object.

remarks.para: If the form is not fully trusted, the NewADODBRecordset method will return a "permission denied" error.

Note: This method is not intended to be used in a managed-code form. To query a Microsoft SQL Server database, use the System.Data.SqlClient namespace and its associated members by adding a reference to System.Data.dll and a using clause to System.Data.SqlClient.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Quit(bool bForce) cil managed

Docs.param: Determines whether open forms will be saved during the quit operation. If set to false, all forms will be closed without saving, even if the data in the forms has been changed. If set to true, the user will be prompted to save the forms. Default value is false.
Docs.summary: Quits the InfoPath application.

remarks.para: If the Quit method is used in a form that is not fully trusted, the method will return a "permission denied" error.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

example.para: In the following example, the Quit method of the object is used to quit InfoPath without saving any of the currently open forms:

MemberSignature.Value: public void RegisterSolution (string bstrSolutionURL, string bstrBehavior);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RegisterSolution(string bstrSolutionURL, string bstrBehavior) cil managed
Public Sub RegisterSolution (bstrSolutionURL As String, bstrBehavior As String)
public: void RegisterSolution(System::String ^ bstrSolutionURL, System::String ^ bstrBehavior);
abstract member RegisterSolution : string * string -> unit

Docs.param: Specifies the Uniform Resource Locator (URL) of the form template. This parameter can be specified as a form definition (.xsf) file or a form template (.xsn) file.
Specifies how the form template is to be installed. Default value is "overwrite". The only other valid value for this parameter is "new-only".
Docs.summary: Installs the specified form template.

remarks.para: If the form template has already been registered, and "new-only" is specified for the parameter, the RegisterSolution method will return an error. If "overwrite" is specified, the form template's registration record will be overwritten.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

example.para: In the following C# example, the RegisterSolution method of the object is used to install a form template:
Note: The above example assumes that the namespace is being used and that the Microsoft InfoPath 3.0 Type Library is referenced.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UnregisterSolution(string bstrSolutionURI) cil managed

Docs.param: Specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the form template.
Docs.summary: Uninstalls the specified form template.

remarks.para: If the form template cannot be unregistered, the UnregisterSolution method will return an error.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

Docs.summary: Gets the InfoPath version number.

remarks.para: The version number of the application does not contain the name. To obtain the name of an application, use the property
To obtain the version number of a form template, use the property.
Important: This member can be accessed without restrictions.

example.para: In the following example, the Version property of the object is used to display the application's version number in a message box:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Windows As WindowsCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the collection.

remarks.para: After you have set a reference to the Windows collection, you can use its properties to access each of the Window objects that it contains.
Note: The Windows collection can be used only to get the count of the Window objects that it contains or to return a reference to a Window object. It cannot be used to add or remove Window objects.
Important: This member can be accessed without restrictions.

example.para: In the following example, the Windows property is used to access the property of the collection and display the value in a message box:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property XDocuments As XDocumentsCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the collection.

remarks.para: After you have set a reference to the XDocuments collection, you can use its properties to access each of the objects that it contains.
Important: This member can be accessed without restrictions.
